title: Surface ligand modified silver nanoparticles-based SERS sensing platform for ultrasensitive detection of the pesticide thiram in green tea leaves: roles of coating agents in sensing performance
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,9975-9984
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA00048J, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Dong Thi Linh, Quan-Doan Mai, Dao Thi Nguyet Nga, Nguyen Tuan Anh, Hoang Van Tuan, Ha Anh Nguyen, Xuan Hoa Vu, Anh-Tuan Le
We fabricated three AgNPs: Ag-citrate, Ag-oleic, and Ag-bio. All exhibit a SERS effect enhancing thiram's Raman signal. Notably, Ag-Oleic shows superior performance, serving as an active SERS substrate for thiram detection in tea leaves.
